verse.roman:
tat-putrāv aparāv āstāṁ
khyātau svārociṣe 'ntare
utathyo bhagavān sākṣād
brahmiṣṭhaś ca bṛhaspatiḥ

synonyms: tat—his; putrau—sons; aparau—others; āstām—were born; khyātau—very famous; svārociṣe—in the Svārociṣa millennium; antare—of the Manu; utathyaḥ—Utathya; bhagavān—very mighty; sākṣāt—directly; brahmiṣṭhaḥ ca—fully spiritually advanced; bṛhaspatiḥ—Bṛhaspati.
translation: Besides these four daughters, she also had another two sons. One of them was known as Utathya, and the other was the learned scholar Bṛhaspati.
